I'm writing test cases for EJB's and some of the beans do some complex SQL 
generation and return large amounts of data,  Realizing that test cases should be 
simple... Should I just test that the query runs without error and not worry about the 
return?  Or should I check certain parts to make sure thay are right?  Or check the 
entire result set?

Question#2: I have many SQL queries with multiple possiblities in the WHERE clause.  
They are being built on the fly based on the search criteria given by a user.  I was 
going to test each WHERE clause in a seperate test. Should I write the tests in such a 
way that I could combine calls to them and have a test case that is more of a 
controller pattern?
pseudo code as follows
<code>
public void combinedTest1(){
     SearchVO search = buildSearchVO ( add two parameters);
     
     performSearchTest(search);

     search = buildSearchVO(two other parameters);

      performSearchTest(search);
}</code>
